keyMoments.title: Decides to Get a New Ship
keyMoments.description: Luffy makes the difficult decision as captain to abandon the Going Merry and get a new ship, despite knowing it will hurt his crew emotionally.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's growth as a captain, prioritizing the crew's safety over sentiment. This is one of his hardest decisions yet.
keyMoments.quote: We need to get a new ship. The Going Merry can't be fixed.

keyMoments.title: Tells Usopp About Going Merry's Fate
keyMoments.description: Luffy delivers the heartbreaking news to Usopp that the Going Merry is going to die and cannot be saved, no matter what they do.
keyMoments.significance: This moment triggers the major conflict with Usopp and tests Luffy's resolve as captain.
keyMoments.quote: The Going Merry... is going to die.

keyMoments.title: Accepts Usopp's Challenge to Duel
keyMoments.description: Luffy accepts Usopp's challenge to duel for ownership of the Going Merry, setting up their emotional confrontation.
keyMoments.significance: Luffy's acceptance shows his respect for Usopp's feelings while also maintaining his position as captain.

relationships.description: Luffy's relationship with Usopp is severely tested as he must make a decision that goes against Usopp's wishes, leading to Usopp leaving the crew and challenging him to a duel.

evolutionMoments.description: Their friendship faces its greatest test when Luffy decides to abandon the Going Merry, causing Usopp to leave the crew and challenge him to a duel.

reveals.information: Demonstrates significant growth as a captain by making an unpopular but necessary decision for the crew's safety

keyMoments.title: Regains Consciousness After Attack
keyMoments.description: Usopp wakes up after being severely beaten by the Franky Family, filled with guilt over losing the crew's money.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Usopp's emotional vulnerability and sense of failure that will drive his actions throughout the episode.
keyMoments.quote: I'm sorry... I couldn't protect the money...

keyMoments.title: Reveals Deep Connection to Going Merry
keyMoments.description: Usopp reveals that the Going Merry was a gift from Kaya and represents his connection to his home and the beginning of his adventure.
keyMoments.significance: Explains why Usopp is so passionate about saving the ship - it's deeply personal to him.
keyMoments.quote: The Going Merry was a gift from Kaya! I can't just throw it away!

keyMoments.title: Leaves the Straw Hat Pirates
keyMoments.description: In a shocking moment, Usopp announces he is quitting the Straw Hat Pirates, feeling he has no place in a crew that doesn't trust or need him.
keyMoments.significance: This is the first voluntary departure of a crew member, marking one of the darkest moments for the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.quote: I quit! I'm leaving the Straw Hat Pirates!

keyMoments.title: Challenges Luffy to a Duel
keyMoments.description: After leaving the crew, Usopp challenges Luffy to a formal duel for ownership of the Going Merry.
keyMoments.significance: This unprecedented challenge between crew members sets up one of the most emotional battles in One Piece.
keyMoments.quote: Luffy! I challenge you to a duel! The Going Merry will be the prize. If I win, I keep the ship!

statusHistory.reason: Quit the Straw Hat Pirates over disagreement about abandoning the Going Merry

relationships.description: Usopp's relationship with Luffy reaches a breaking point when he disagrees with Luffy's decision to abandon the Going Merry. Despite leaving the crew, he still believes in Luffy's dream.

evolutionMoments.description: Usopp leaves the crew and challenges Luffy to a duel, though he still acknowledges that he believes Luffy will become King of the Pirates.

relationships.description: Usopp has the deepest emotional connection to the Going Merry as it was a gift from Kaya. He sees the ship as more than just a vessel - it's a piece of his home and his dreams.

evolutionMoments.description: Usopp's attachment to the Going Merry causes him to leave the crew rather than accept its fate.

reveals.information: Deep insecurity about his weakness and value to the crew, feeling that he can be discarded just like the Going Merry
The Going Merry represents his connection to Kaya and his home village, making it deeply personal

keyMoments.title: Emotional Reaction to Usopp's Departure
keyMoments.description: Nami is devastated by the conflict between Luffy and Usopp, breaking down in tears as she witnesses the crew splitting apart.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Nami's role as the emotional heart of the crew and how deeply the conflict affects everyone.
keyMoments.quote: Luffy... what are we going to do?

keyMoments.title: Tries to Prevent Escalation
keyMoments.description: Zoro attempts to warn Luffy and Usopp before their argument gets out of hand, but ultimately respects the situation and doesn't interfere.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's understanding of crew dynamics and his respect for both Luffy's authority as captain and Usopp's feelings.

keyMoments.title: Witnessing Crew Conflict
keyMoments.description: Sanji is visibly troubled by the argument between Luffy and Usopp and the subsequent departure of their crewmate.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how the conflict affects all members of the crew, not just those directly involved.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Confusion and Fear Over Crew Split
keyMoments.description: Chopper is confused and scared by the conflict, not fully understanding why Luffy and Usopp are fighting and why Usopp is leaving.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the innocence lost as the crew faces internal conflict for the first time.
